body: Mauricio, If you want a single window for which you can adjust the sill height and window height, you can just set the 'breakUpDist' to be a very large number that is longer than your wall and leave 'breakUpWindow' set to True: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/6dxYD0J5CcqYuDcYgim*SNJTKQBszzbAHB5kpIe5dQdfPjJ26eoH1jJgSOXOBZeU5em9cXpz1p8S*4NJCjE8p9JMu*X36eol/SingleWindowWithAdjustableHeight.JPG) Trust me when I say that this component has been though so many rounds of revision that it can produce a huge set of variations on typical orthogonal window geometry.  This old github issue may also get your mental gears turning about the other things you can make with the simple parameters of this component: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/111](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/111) I really recommend taking a set of sliders with a single HBSrf as input to the component and explore its design space. -Chris
